column4: Another question, the installer says that it can keep installed programs on the new Precise system if I upgrade directly from Natty to Precise.. Does that really work? Is there any way to do it manually with advanced partitioning?
I knew you'd tell me that, and I think the same too. Any way to make a list of installed programs?
I hope I can just sudo apt-get install it >.>
Maybe I'll use aptoncd because I want to start fresh and maybe there will be some packages that I don't want anymore, thanks for you great help anyways. =D
Umm.. APTonCD is certainly NOT displaying all my packages.
It just lists packages available in the apt cache
any way to make it list every package? ._.
What you exactly wanted to do is to make a list of names of all installed packages.
I guess I will open Gedit and do it. xD
I think this will do it for you : dpkg --get-selections > installed-software
jeep Actually the first command outputs something that can be used to reinstall those packages back, That is exactly what Elesa want to do
dpkg --set-selections < installed-software Use this command when you are done with your fresh install get all those packages back installed.
if you don't find precise packages, you will need to build it your own.
If you have data in that partition it could take time
So it will take time usually
